content: hello, i have a question - is it intentionally, that stream members only get highlightet wenn you highlight a message in the stream (but not if you select the stream/topic in the left column) ? i always find this confusing
Stream members only get highlighted when the compose box is open, that is intentional.
ok - but what is the intention / reason for that ?
It helps the sender identify which users will see the message.

ok, but what does that matter if users would be also highlightet when clicking on the stream or topic in the left column? it's illogical to me that only compose box selection will highlight them but not topic or stream selection. could you explain?
every chat i know which shows channel members will highlight or list users when entering the channel

My suspicion is that this is related to composition being disconnected from the current narrow (eg. a certain stream), and also perhaps by a desire to keep the full user list available? Is the rationale in a design document somewhere?

what effect has user highlighting regarding their availability (for visibility/selection...) ? and why/how can composition be "disconnected" from the current stream? isn't every message being selected clearly belonging to a stream/topic ?
One can compose a message which does not match the current narrow (PM/stream/starred/...); I'm not sure if that's a factor.
RolandK has marked this topic as resolved.
RolandK has marked this topic as unresolved.

i'm still dissatisfied/unconfortable with the current way of user highlighting. i think it's inconsistent behaviour.

why do i need to select message for getting to the information who is member of the stream, why doesn't that happen when entering the stream and selecting on the left?

i this is intentional, please explain.

if this is not intentional, i think it should be fixed.

there is an old ticket for this: https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/16835

Neil Pilgrim (neiljp) said:

My suspicion is that this is related to composition being disconnected from the current narrow (eg. a certain stream), and also perhaps by a desire to keep the full user list available? Is the rationale in a design document somewhere?

the full user list is always available , the only difference is the highlighting
